keyword: how many calories in 1 tbsp of peanut butter
title: How Many Calories in 1 Tbsp Peanut Butter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 tbsp of peanut butter, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fats, carbs, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Tbsp Peanut Butter?
assumptions: Smooth, natural peanut butter; no added sugar, salt, or oils; approximately 16 g per tablespoon.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (natural vs. processed), additives, and measurement accuracy. Check labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of peanut butter provides about 94 kcal and 4 g of protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use chunky peanut butter instead of smooth
Add 1 tsp jelly for a PB&J spread

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tbsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 94 kcal for 1 tbsp of natural peanut butter.

faqs.q: Is peanut butter high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp provides about 4 g of protein.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a tablespoon of peanut butter?
faqs.a: Around 8 g total fat, including 1.5 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does natural peanut butter have less sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, natural varieties have about 0.7 g sugars per tbsp vs. more in sweetened types.

faqs.q: What affects calories in peanut butter?
faqs.a: Brand, added sugars/oils, and whether it's natural or processed; always check the label.
